Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in determining the applicant did not meet NOC 0621 requirements
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's duties as Front Store Manager compared to NOC 0621
Decision_Outcome: Application rejected due to perceived mismatch in duties, specifically 'competitors' operations'
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate 12 months of skilled work experience under NOC 0 or level A/B within 24 months prior
Legal_Rule: Applicant must demonstrate 12 months of skilled work experience under NOC skill type 0 or level A/B within 24 months before application
Procedural_Issue: Lack of justification and inadequate reasoning by visa officer
Outcome_on_Merits: Officer's decision found unreasonable; case remanded for reconsideration
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness concerns due to lack of adequate explanation
Key_Evidence_Considered: Job duties of Front Store Manager
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged rejection of permanent residence application under CEC
Court_Result: Application for judicial review allowed; decision set aside
Outcome: Decision quashed, remitted to another officer for reconsideration
Remedy_Sought: Reconsideration of application by a different visa officer
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative re-determination
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet NOC 0621 skilled work experience requirement
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application under Canadian Experience Class
Governing_Rule: NOC 0621 job duty alignment with applicantâ€™s experience
